text:
RT @Feargal_Sharkey: This is what regulatory failure looks like.

Wouldn't that be right @WaterUK, @DefraGovUK, @Ofwat, & @EnvAgency?

@Feargal_Sharkey @MonicaHone @CleanIlkley @defra @thameswater @stwater @wessexwater @DwrCymru @YorkshireWater @EnvAgency ‚ÄúAs part of the river's new bathing water status, samples of the water will be taken regularly, starting this month, to ensure it is safe for bathers.‚Äù So it is not safe now? Making it safe means stopping sewage discharges and agricultural run-off.

@wrurestore @shafm13 @Feargal_Sharkey @WaterUK @DefraGovUK @Ofwat @EnvAgency @NatResWales @fmwales @Amanwy @Eluned_Morgan Simply incorrect. The mains cause is Water Company sewage discharge, some authorised, most, illegal. Period. The dead wood at regulators are doing a job on demonising farming as a scapegoat & dreaming up new laws to castigate them. All while not enforcing existing regulations
